sen.j: 式神・識神（しきがみ、しきじん）、式の神ともいい、文献によっては式鬼（しき）、式鬼神とも）とは、陰陽師が使役する鬼神のことで、人心から起こる悪行や善行を見定める役を務めるもの。
sen.e: Called by various names such as Shikigami, Shikijin, Shiki no Kami, and in literature the Shiki (Demon) or Shiki Kijin (Fierce God), they were fierce gods summoned by the Onmyoji (priests) to judge the evil doings and well doings of the populace.

Shikigami or Shikijin were fierce gods employed by the Onmyoji (Master of Yin yang) to judge the evil doings and well doings of the populace, and they were also called Shiki no Kami, and in some literature, Shiki or Shiki Kijin.
sen.cmt: 文章の意味が通りません。ウィキペディアを見ると以下の文章になっていますので、その通りに修正した訳をtrans2に載せました。「式神・識神（しきがみ、しきじん）とは、陰陽師が使役する鬼神のことで、人心から起こる悪行や善行を見定める役を務めるもの。式の神ともいい、文献によっては式鬼（しき）、式鬼神ともいう。」「使役する」はemployにしました。
sen.e: Shikigami or Shikijin were fierce gods employed by the Onmyoji (Master of Yin yang) to judge the evil doings and well doings of the populace, and they were also called Shiki no Kami, and in some literature, Shiki or Shiki Kijin.

sen.j: ｢式｣とは｢用いる｣の意味であり、使役することをあらわす。
sen.e: "Shiki" means "to use" and to employ.
Shiki' means 'to use' and to employ.
Shiki' means 'to use' and to employ.
Kijin
Kijin (fierce god)
sen.cmt: 鬼神の訳を用語集に揃えました。
sen.e: Kijin (fierce god)

sen.j: 荒ぶる神または、妖怪のこと。
sen.e: Malignant gods and demons.
It refers to malignant gods and specters.
sen.cmt: 文章にしました。妖怪の訳を用語集に揃えました。
sen.e: It refers to malignant gods and specters.
"Reikon" (Departed soul)
It is a Reikon (Departed soul.)
It is a Reikon (Departed soul.)

sen.j: 仏教用語としての、様々な不思議な現象を起こすとされる超人的存在のこと。
sen.e: In Buddhist terminology, a supernatural existence that causes wondrous phenomenon.
In Buddhist terminology, it is a supernatural existence that causes mysterious phenomena.
sen.cmt: 文章にしました。Wondrousはニュアンスが合いませんので、修正しました。
sen.e: In Buddhist terminology, it is a supernatural existence that causes mysterious phenomena.
Onmyodo (Yin and Yang)
Onmyodo (yin-yang philosophy)
sen.cmt: 陰陽道の訳を用語集に揃えました。
sen.e: Onmyodo (yin-yang philosophy)

sen.j: 陰陽道は神道（古神道）に道教の陰陽五行思想や、密教などの思想を取り入れ習合したもので、現在の神社神道にもその系譜としての思想や儀式がある。
sen.e: Onmyodo is a combination of Shinto (Koshinto) with the Taoist philosophy of Inyo Gogyo Shiso (Yin-Yang Wu Hsing Idealism) and mysticism, and strains of this can be found in present day Shinto theology and ceremony.

Onmyodo is a combination of Shinto (Ancient Shinto) and the Inyo Gogyo Shiso (Yin-Yang Wu Hsing Ideal) of Taoism and the philosophy of mysticism, and strains of this can be found in the present day Shrine Shinto theology and ceremony.
sen.cmt: 「古神道」は意味が分かるようにAncient Shintoとしました。「道教の陰陽五行思想」の訳を修正しました。神社神道の訳を用語集に揃えました。文法を修正しました。
sen.e: Onmyodo is a combination of Shinto (Ancient Shinto) and the Inyo Gogyo Shiso (Yin-Yang Wu Hsing Ideal) of Taoism and the philosophy of mysticism, and strains of this can be found in the present day Shrine Shinto theology and ceremony.

sen.j: 神主や巫女は神降ろしによって、神を呼び出し憑依させることを、神楽や祈祷というが、これは和御魂の神霊であり、式神は鬼神となっていることから、和御魂の神霊だけではなく、荒御魂の神霊いわゆる「荒ぶる神」や「妖怪変化」の類である位の低い神を呼び出し、使役したと考えられる。
sen.e: When the Kannushi (high priest) and Miko (high priestess) summoned the god and allowed themselves to be possessed by them through Kagura (Ancient Shinto music and dancing) and Kito (prayers) they invoked the divine spirit of Nikitama (the peaceful side of God), and since Shikigami was a fierce god, it was believed that they (Onmyoshi) employed not the divine spirit of Nikitama but the divine spirit of Aratama, the "violent god" and the gods of lower status who morphed into specters and monsters.

When the Kannushi (high priest) and Miko (high priestess) summon the god and allow themselves to be possessed by the god through Kagura (Ancient Shinto music and dancing) and Kito (prayers,) they invoke the divine spirit of Nigimitama (spirits of peace), but since Shikigami is said to have been a fierce god, it is believed that Onmyoji employed not only the divine spirit of Nigimitama but also the divine spirit of Aramitama (violent soul,) that is a 'violent god' and 'the gods of lower status who morphed into specters and monsters.'
sen.cmt: 「和御魂」「荒御魂」の訳を用語集に揃えました。文法を修正しました。
sen.e: When the Kannushi (high priest) and Miko (high priestess) summon the god and allow themselves to be possessed by the god through Kagura (Ancient Shinto music and dancing) and Kito (prayers,) they invoke the divine spirit of Nigimitama (spirits of peace), but since Shikigami is said to have been a fierce god, it is believed that Onmyoji employed not only the divine spirit of Nigimitama but also the divine spirit of Aramitama (violent soul,) that is a 'violent god' and 'the gods of lower status who morphed into specters and monsters.'

sen.j: また、人の善悪を監視するということは、人の心（霊魂）の和御魂と荒御魂の状態の変化でもあり、このことも式神という、2つの状態のどちらかの神霊を、使役したことと係わっていると思われる。
sen.e: Observing the good and evil within people, one sees the movement of people's hearts (souls) between Nikitama and Aramitama, the two different sides of Shikigami, and how it all depends on which divine spirit of Shikigami they employ.

Observing the good and evil within people, one sees the movement of people's hearts (souls) between Nigimitama and Aramitama, which is why Shikigami who possessed the two different spirits were employed.
sen.cmt: 単語を用語集に揃えました。訳文の意味が不明瞭でしたので後半部分を大幅に修正しました。
sen.e: Observing the good and evil within people, one sees the movement of people's hearts (souls) between Nigimitama and Aramitama, which is why Shikigami who possessed the two different spirits were employed.

sen.j: 四国の高知県に伝わる陰陽道の一派いざなぎ流では、式王子（しきおうじ）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Izanagi-ryu, a form of Onmyodo that is handed down in Kochi Prefecture, Shikoku, is called "Shikiouji".
Izanagi-ryu, a form of Onmyodo that is handed down in Kochi Prefecture, Shikoku, is called 'Shikiouji.'
Izanagi-ryu, a form of Onmyodo that is handed down in Kochi Prefecture, Shikoku, is called 'Shikiouji.'

sen.j: 陰陽道の大家で、陰陽師として知られる安倍晴明が使役したという式神に十二神将（十二天将）がある。
sen.e: The famed Onmyoshi, ABE no Seimei, who descended from a notable house of Onmyodo, used a method called Juni Shinsho (also called Juni Tensho).
The famed Onmyoji, ABE no Seimei, expert of Onmyodo, used Shikigami called Juni Shinsho (the twelve protective deities) (also called Juni Tensho.)
sen.cmt: 陰陽師はOnmyojiとしました。大家はexpertとしました。十二神将の説明を用語集に揃えて補いました。
sen.e: The famed Onmyoji, ABE no Seimei, expert of Onmyodo, used Shikigami called Juni Shinsho (the twelve protective deities) (also called Juni Tensho.)

sen.j: 陰陽師もしくはそれを下地にした物語の式神は、和紙札の状態（式札と呼ばれる）で、使用時には鳥や獣等へ術師の意志で自在に姿を変えるというように描かれることが事が多いが、『不動利益縁起』に描かれる式神は、室町時代から江戸時代にまでの、擬人化された鶏や牛の器物（道具）の妖怪と同じものであり、これは荒ぶる神としての式神をあらわしている。
sen.e: In most literature and tales about, or involving, an Onmyoshi the Shikigami that the Onmyoshi employs usually appears in the form of a piece of washi (Japanese paper) that morphs into a bird or beast as it pleases when summoned, but the "Fudo-riyaku-engi" describes the Shikigami as an anthropomorphic vessel (tool) shaped as a bird or cow, much like the spectres and demons throughout the Muromachi Era and Edo Era. It depicts the Shikigami as a violent god.

In most literature and tales about, or involving an Onmyoji, the Shikigami that the Onmyoji employed usually appears in the form of a piece of washi (Japanese paper) that morphs into a bird or beast according to the will of Onmyoji, but the "Fudo-riyaku-engi" describes the Shikigami as an anthropomorphic vessel (tool) shaped as a bird or cow, much like the specters and demons throughout the Muromachi period to the Edo period and it depicts the Shikigami as a violent god.
sen.cmt: 陰陽師はOnmyojiとしました。スペルミスを修正しました。文法を修正しました。時代はperiodとしました。
sen.e: In most literature and tales about, or involving an Onmyoji, the Shikigami that the Onmyoji employed usually appears in the form of a piece of washi (Japanese paper) that morphs into a bird or beast according to the will of Onmyoji, but the "Fudo-riyaku-engi" describes the Shikigami as an anthropomorphic vessel (tool) shaped as a bird or cow, much like the specters and demons throughout the Muromachi period to the Edo period and it depicts the Shikigami as a violent god.
Ushu no Koku Mairi
Ushi no Koku Mairi
sen.cmt: 「丑の刻」は正しくはUshi no Kokuだと思います。
sen.e: Ushi no Koku Mairi

sen.j: 平安時代から続く、丑の刻参りという呪術があり、古くは神木（神体）に釘を打ち付け、自身が鬼となって恨む相手に復讐するというものである。
sen.e: There is a occult practice called "Ushu no Koku Mairi" that has continued from the Heian Era, where one would put a nail into a sacred tree, become a demon and invoke a curse on a hated enemy.
There is an occult art called Ushi no koku mairi that has continued from the Heian period, which one would drive a nail into a sacred tree, become a demon and invoke a curse on a hated enemy.
sen.cmt: 「呪術」の訳を用語集に揃えました。「丑の刻」はUshi no kokuに修正しました。時代はperiodとしました。言い回しを修正しました。記号を修正しました。
sen.e: There is an occult art called Ushi no koku mairi that has continued from the Heian period, which one would drive a nail into a sacred tree, become a demon and invoke a curse on a hated enemy.

sen.j: 丑の刻（深夜）に神木に釘を打って結界を破り、常夜（夜だけの神の国）から、禍をもたらす神（魔や妖怪）を呼び出し、神懸りとなって恨む相手を祟ると考えられていた。
sen.e: By putting a nail into a sacred tree at "Ushu no Koku" (midnight from 1 am to 3 am) it was believed that the barrier between worlds would be broken and the evil-wreaking gods (devils and specters) would be summoned from the Tokoyo (eternal night), possessing the summoner and cursing whoever they hated.

By driving a nail into a sacred tree at Ushi no koku (midnight from 1 am to 3 am,) it was believed that the barrier between worlds would be broken and the evil-wreaking gods (devils and specters) would be summoned from the Tokoyo (eternal night kingdom of God), possessing the summoner and cursing whoever they hated.
sen.cmt: 「丑の刻」はUshi no Kokuに修正しました。言い回しを修正しました。「常夜」の説明は（夜だけの神の国）に修正しました。記号を修正しました。
sen.e: By driving a nail into a sacred tree at Ushi no koku (midnight from 1 am to 3 am,) it was believed that the barrier between worlds would be broken and the evil-wreaking gods (devils and specters) would be summoned from the Tokoyo (eternal night kingdom of God), possessing the summoner and cursing whoever they hated.

sen.j: 丑の刻参りもこのように、妖怪を呼び出し、祟るために使役する点においては同じといえる。
sen.e: In this way, the Ushu-no-koku-mairi was much the same in that they would summon demons and have them place a curse.
sen.cmt: うえの文書とあっていないようです。
sen.e: Ushi no koku mairi and Onmyodo were much the same in that they would summon specter and have them place a curse.
sen.cmt: 陰陽道と「同じ」と解釈しました。「丑の刻」はUshi no kokuに修正しました。記号を修正しました。「妖怪」の訳を用語集に揃えました。
sen.e: Ushi no koku mairi and Onmyodo were much the same in that they would summon specter and have them place a curse.
